title: Alright, fucking rework tryndamere already.
body: Right click the lane and press r. Nice man.

replies.body: I think the biggest problem is you have to force someone on your team to babysit the lane he's in so he doesn't solo end the game by crushing all the towers.    Playing top against trynd actually just sucks the fun out of the game sometimes because you don't actually get to play the game with the rest of your team.

Honestly there are loads of champions that can pull off this strategy, just not as simply as Tryn.  Their waveclear and damage costs mana while Tryn is resourceless so this simple strategy is easiest for him to pull off.

Think about it: Tryn's innate crit chance doesn't affect towers, he has no strong waveclear ability, he has no AS boosts in his kit and he usually doesn't benefit from a good chunk of his bonus AD while pushing on his own.  He does not seem like the best candidate for splitpushing except for the fact that he lives 5 seconds longer than any other carry.

I think Tryn can be a perfectly good team player.  There are a lot of good tank items now that he benefits from, namely the classic Spirit Visage as well as some others, and his W in teamfights can be really handy.  Riot just needs to make top lane towers not made out of paper mache so that nobody, including Trodnomore, can pull off this particularly brainless strategy.  There is nothing fascinating about seeing whether or not your team can win a game 4v4.

**Edit:** I didn't mean to reply to Exiled Cat haha.  I agree with what he says entirely if anyone's wondering.

His E and Shiv proc, since he synergizes with crit really well, instantly clears minion waves.  He's a crit-based melee ADC, so his build shreds turrets just as quickly as any other ADC.  His W slow and E provide the perfect escape if the team (or at least 3 people) collapses on him, and his ult lets him 1v1 anyone that tries to stop him solo.

You can't crit towers. While yes, he clears towers at the same rate as the average marksman ADC, those ADCs are often busy doing teamfight things that Tryn can't do.

He doesn't splitpush because he's magically better at it than anyone else, or even particularly good for that matter. He splitpushes because it's one of the few things he does well.

TL:DR the reason they can't do that is because it creates a perpetual arms race.

___

So let's start here. Why is someone like malzahar or tryn considered an anti-fun laner? They aren't particularly strong. In malzahar's case it was said, it's because he's not very "interactive". Though now we need to decompress that word a little bit. What does it mean, in a game like league to be "interactive". Generally, it's going to be due to him having a low tempo of play, and punishing champions who try to play at a higher tempo of play.
Other low interactive champions include ones like {{champion:22}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:75}} exc.

So say that you make these champions which are not very interactive not "anti-fun". What would that involve? It would involve removing their ability to punish high tempo play. 
In which case, you've backed yourself into a corner design wise. You no longer can create low tempo champions, because high tempo is inherently better due to having higher precision of champion control. 
Yet, you can't create a high tempo champion which punishes high tempo play, because then their only weakness (being force into low tempo play) have been forced out of the game.
So the only real option is to create high tempo champions which don't punish high tempo champions. Which basically just means that the higher tempo champion with the higher impact kit will be superior. 

Now, the best solution to this problem would be to make high tempo champions more flexible in their playstyles. The only problem is that riot is actively preventing this by trying to increase class and champion "identity", which is directly counter to champion flexibility as it pigeonholes players into fewer play styles per champion.

If he's so absolutely powerful, you should main him. Work your way up to challenger. Or, the more likely outcome is that you'll find many people able to outplay his ultimate. Then, armed with the knowledge that he can be defeated, study what they did against you, and act like them.
